title: Izzy Ford
text:
Izzy I. Ford (née Gray; born 19 January 1974) is a New Zealand local-body politician and former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. She has served as deputy <a href="mayor%20of%20Porirua">mayor of Porirua</a> since 2016.
Early life and family.
Ford was born in <a href="Porirua">Porirua</a> on 19 January 1974, and was educated at <a href="Bishop%20Viard%20College">Bishop Viard College</a>. She is married to Glynn Ford, and they have three children, including Jayden Ford, who in January 2022 was the 399th-ranked amateur golfer in the world.
Rugby union.
Ford made her debut for the New Zealand women's national rugby team, the <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Black Ferns</a>, against <a href="Canada%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a> at <a href="Palmerston%20North">Palmerston North</a> in 1999. She was named in the <a href="2002%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2002 Women's Rugby World Cup</a> squad for New Zealand.
In 2017, Ford became the first woman appointed to the Wellington Rugby Board for 20 years; <a href="Fran%20Wilde">Fran Wilde</a> had served on the board in 1996.
Local politics.
Ford was first elected as a <a href="Porirua%20City%20Council">Porirua city councillor</a> for the Eastern Ward in 2013. She was re-elected in 2016 and 2019, when she was the top-polling candidate in the Eastern Ward. Ford stood for the Porirua mayoralty at the <a href="2019%20New%20Zealand%20local%20elections">2019 local-body elections</a>, and finished third out of six candidates. She has served as the deputy mayor of Porirua since 2016.
